business.headline: No work, no pay: Samsung warns workers on strike in Chennai The strike, which began on September 9, 2024, involves hundreds of workers at Samsung's home appliances factory near Chennai.

Sensex ends 1,400 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; ICICI Bank jumps 5%At the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,381.99 points to 84,566.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 375.15 points to settle at 25,790.95.
Ashneer Grover shares reason behind his one-day exit from EY. Check hereIn an old video, Grover shares why he left Ernst & Young (EY) on his very first day despite being offered a Rs 1 crore salary.

Should you buy Vodafone Idea shares after 20% fall? UBS shares new target priceVodafone Idea shares fell 20% after the Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed the company's curative petition, which sought a re-computation of Adjusted Gross Revenue (AGR) dues.
Explained: Why IIFL Finance shares surged 13% todayIIFL Finance stock climbed to a high of Rs 560.60, marking its peak since late February, before settling to trade 9.31% higher as of 2:06 pm.
Explained: Why Cochin Shipyard shares soared 10% todayAt around 12:25 pm, shares of the company were up 9.45% at Rs 1,837.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Western Carriers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusWestern Carriers IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online via the BSE website or through Link Intime India Private Ltd.

iPhone 16 in 10 minutes: Quick commerce firms bring fight to Amazon, FlipkartiPhone 16 sales: Quick commerce platforms like Blinkit, BigBasket and Zepto have started delivering the latest iPhone 16 in minutes, challenging traditional e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart.
Sensex jumps over 1,276 points to cross 84,400, Nifty nears 25,800The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1275.45 points to 84,460.25 at 12:49 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 368.70 points to trade at 25,784.50.

Northern Arc IPO allotment: Latest GMP, step-by-step guide to check statusNorthern Arc IPO allotment: To check their share allocation, investors should visit the IPO registrar's portal or the BSE and NSE websites.

RITES shares rise 8% but why railway PSU stock may be showing 48% slideDespite this positive momentum, many investors were caught off guard, seeing what appeared to be a 48% slide in the stock price on their trading apps.
Elliott Hill's 32-year journey at Nike from intern to CEO goes viralElliott Hill, who has spent over 32 years at Nike, started his journey as an intern and will now be leading the iconic company.
Sensex surges 500 points, Nifty gains momentum; JSW Steel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 415.45 points at 83,600.25 at 10:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 135.80 points to trade at 25,550.90.

Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Check status, GMP, subscription Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status by logging into the BSE website or the Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd website, the issue's registrar.
Northern Arc Capital IPO allotment tomorrow: Check latest subscription, GMPNorthern Arc Capital Limited, founded in 2009, provides retail loans to underserved households and businesses across India.

Sensex, Nifty end higher after US Fed's 50 bps rate cut; NTPC gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 236.57 points higher at 83,184.80, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 38.25 points higher at 25,415.80. Both the indices had hit fresh all-time highs in early trade.
Government working on new income tax act. Check inside detailsThe new tax framework aims to replace the current 1961 act, simplifying the tax process for individuals and businesses.

RPSG's Firstsource expands globally, eyes $550 million boost from AIThe expansion is part of Firstsource's strategy to improve its business margins while continuing to create jobs in India. For every position created in Australia, the company plans to create three jobs in India.

Gold prices react to US Fed rate cut: What investors need to knowThe US Federal Reserve's rate cuts aim to stabilise the economy but raise concerns about their impact on global markets, particularly on gold prices, a key investment in uncertain times.

Explained: Why small and midcap stocks are under pressure todayPublic Sector Undertaking (PSU) stocks, particularly in sectors such as defence, railways, and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), have been hit hard.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Politics in name of God: Jagan Reddy refutes charges amid Tirupati laddoos rowFormer Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy has dismissed the ruling Telugu Desam Party's charges of the presence of lard, beef tallow and fish oil in the ghee used for the preparation of the laddoos at Tirupati temple.

Kicked on chest, flashed: Army officer's fiancée on Odisha police station ordealThe Army officer and his fiancée had approached Bharatpur police station to file a complaint about road rage. However, what followed was a harrowing experience for the couple.

Collegium not a search panel: Supreme Court pulls up Centre on judges' selectionAs per convention, the government is obliged to accept the collegium's recommendation for appointment of judges if the decision has been reiterated.

Gurugram biker death: Accused was previously fined for wrong side drivingGurugram SUV-bike crash: Akshat Garg died last week after his bike was hit by an SUV that was being driven recklessly in the wrong direction on Golf Course Road in DLF Phase II.

050507497 does not exist: When Israeli mobile bomb killed The Engineer in 1996Yahya Ayyash, popular as 'The Engineer', was Hamas's chief bombmaker whose devices had killed around 150 people. Spy agency Shin Beit used a cellphone bomb to kill Israel's most-wanted terrorist in 1996, when most of the world hadn't even seen a mobile. His killing came three decades before Hezbollah pager blasts in Lebanon.
Ashneer Grover shares reason behind his one-day exit from EY. Check hereIn an old video, Grover shares why he left Ernst & Young (EY) on his very first day despite being offered a Rs 1 crore salary.

Laddoo samples found to be 'pathetic', highly adulterated: Tirupati temple official Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) Executive Officer stated that five lab tests confirmed the use of lard (pig fat) and poor-quality ghee in laddoos distributed to the devotees of Lord Venkateswara shrine.

Rajinikanth loses cool ahead of Vettaiyan event: Don't ask political questionsSuperstar Rajinikanth arrived in Chennai hours before the grand audio launch of his upcoming film, Vettaiyan. He lashed out at a reporter who asked him a political question about Udhayanidhi Stalin.

Viral at Paris Olympics, Korean shooter Kim Yeji lands acting role as assassin South Korean Kim Yeji landed her first acting role, a month after she went viral at the Paris Olympics for her distinctive style at the range. Kim will work with Indian actor Anushka Sen in a spin-off series of the film 'Asia'

Changed ghee brand behind 'animal fat in Tirupati laddoo' controversy?Chandrababu Naidu's claim, citing a lab report, that animal fat was found in the ghee procured during the YSR Congress Party regime has brought into focus the halt in the supply of the famous Nandini ghee last year.

Union Health Minister asks for report on Tirupati laddoos amid animal fat row Union Health Minister JP Nadda has sought a report on the alleged use of animal fat in the making of Tirupati laddoos and ensured that action will be taken after the examination of the report by the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI).

Memes take over social media as Blinkit, BigBasket deliver iPhone 16 in minutesAs quick commerce platforms such as Blinkit, Zepto, and BigBasket delivered iPhones within minutes to customers, hilarious memes and jokes flooded social media.

Mamata Banerjee writes to PM Modi over Bengal floods, seeks urgent action  In the letter to PM Modi, Mamata Banerjee urged the Centre to immediately release central funds to mitigate the widespread devastation caused by the floods.

Jagan Reddy's party approaches court amid 'animal fat in Tirupati laddoo' rowLawyers representing the party requested the court if a sitting judge or a committee appointed by the High Court could investigate the claims made by Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu.

Supreme Court raps CBI for claiming Bengal courts are hostile, warns of contemptA bench of Justices Abhay S Oka and Pankaj Mithal expressed displeasure over the CBI's plea, stressing that the central probe agency had cast aspersions on the entire judiciary of West Bengal.
Video: Drunk rehab manager assaults addicts seeking help at Surat centerAllegations suggest the manager has a history of assaulting those seeking treatment while under the influence of alcohol.

Will never happen again: Rajiv Memani on EY missing funeral of employeeErnst and Young India chairperson Rajiv Memani has expressed regret on no one from the company attending the funeral of its employee, who died allegedly due to excessive work pressure.

Supreme Court rebukes High Court judge over Pak comment on Karnataka localityDuring a recent hearing on a landlord-tenant dispute, Justice Srishananda called a Muslim-majority area in Bengaluru "Pakistan" and made a misogynistic remark involving a woman advocate.

iPhone 16 buyer gets tired of queues, orders online and receives it in minutesThe iPhone 16 series sale is now live on both online and offline stores. The enthusiasts have been standing outside the store since last night, hoping to be the first ones to get their hands on the new gen iPhones. However, one customer was done with the queues and could not wait any longer. Here is what he did.

Actor Shama Sikander on attempting suicide 15 years ago: Asked God to make a dealIn an interview recently, actor Shama Sikander remembered the most difficult phase of her life and talked about suffering from bipolar disorder. The Yeh Meri Life Hai star shared that she attempted suicide and was saved by her family.

How pager blasts, Hamas chief killing have brought Middle East to brink of warIsrael-Hezbollah War: Even though the intensity of the hostilities has waxed and waned, there is no sign of a pause in the year-long war in Gaza. The pager blasts in Lebanon have further pushed the Middle East to the brink of a full-blown regional war.

How Mahatma Gandhi framed Ambedkar in the Dalit struggleIn September 1932, Mahatma Gandhi began a fast from prison to oppose the separate electorate supported by Dr. BR Ambedkar, who believed it was vital for empowering the Depressed Classes. Gandhi's fast contradicted his principles of satyagraha and deepened the rift between him and Ambedkar while highlighting key issues of representation and identity in India's quest for equality.

Clashes in Karnataka as stones thrown during Ganpati procession, cop injuredThe clash broke out when the procession was passing through Aralimara Circle, which is near a minority-dominated area. Stones were allegedly thrown at the procession when it passed through the area, following which the clash broke out.

Rakt Brahmand: Samantha begins shooting for Raj and DK's Netflix seriesActor Samantha has begun shooting Raj and DK's Netflix series, Rakt Bramhand. She announced the same with a picture from the shooting sets.

Vettaiyan: Amitabh Bachchan introduced as Sathyadev in Rajinikanth's filmMegastar Amitabh Bachchan will be essaying the role of Sathyadev in Rajinikanth's highly-anticipated Vettaiyan. The film also stars Rana Daggubati, Fahadh Faasil and Manju Warrier, among others.

Choreographer Jani Master's wife demands evidence after his arrest in POCSO caseTelugu choreographer Jani Master was arrested by Cyberabad police in a POCSO case. His wife now spoke to the media and questioned the survivor's decision to lodge a late complaint. She also demanded evidence in the case.

Sebastian Stan on his intense transformation into Donald Trump for The ApprenticeActor Sebastian Stan is set to portray Donald Trump in Ali Abbasi's upcoming film, The Apprentice. The film will delve into Trump's early business years, for which Stan has undergone a major transformation for the role.

sports.headline: South Africa thrash Pakistan in decider to claim WT20I series PAK vs SA: South Africa beat Pakistan by 8 wickets in the deciding game at the Multan Cricket Stadium to claim the three-match T20I series 2-1.

Top Moments of Sachin Tendulkar's career in Pictures Legendary India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar had a 24-year-long career in international cricket where he witnessed several top moments on the pitch. Here's a look at Tendulkar's top career moments through pictures.

IND vs BAN: Rohit Sharma suffers rare twin failure in Chennai TestIndia captain Rohit Sharma suffered a rare twin failure in the Chennai Test match. Rohit, for the fourth time in his Test career, got out for single-digit scores in both innings.
Pakistan vs England second Test shifted to Multan PAK vs ENG: The PCB has moved the second Test between Pakistan and England out of Karachi. Multan will host the Test match.

Virat Kohli's best action moments from 2024Virat Kohli was part of some incredible moments in 2024 as he had a fantastic IPL and T20 World Cup this year. Kohli played a starring role in both tournaments.

Explained: Why was Shakib Al Hasan biting his helmet string while batting vs India?Bangladesh cricketer Shakib Al Hasan was seen adopting a unique technique while batting during Day 2 of the first Test against India at MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai.

Tamim Iqbal hails Rohit Sharma, Jadeja's masterstroke on Day 2 of Chennai TestIND vs BAN: Former Bangladesh batter Tamim Iqbal hailed Rohit Sharma and Ravindra Jadeja's planning masterclass on Day 2 of the Chennai Test. Tamim said the Indian duo planned the wicket of Litton Das brilliantly.

Not going to accept mediocrity: Ricky Ponting's mantra for PBKS revivalRicky Ponting has said that he will not be accepting mediocrity at PBKS after becoming the new coach of the franchise. Ponting took over as the PBKS coach after leaving DC at the end of 2024 season.

Jasprit Bumrah becomes 6th Indian pacer to take 400 international wickets India vs Bangladesh: Jasprit Bumrah became only the 10th Indian bowler to take 400 wickets in international cricket. The fast bowler achieved the feat after taking 3 wickets in the first two sessions on Day 2 of the Chennai Test.

Yuzvendra Chahal signs off for Northamptonshire with 19 county wicketsYuzvendra Chahal ended his county championship stint with another 5-wicket haul as Northamptonshire secured a dominant nine-wicket victory over Leicestershire.

Watch: Rishabh Pant apologises to Mohammad Siraj after DRS error leaves him lividIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant apologised to Mohammed Siraj on Day 2 of the second Test against Bangladesh after his DRS error denied him a wicket.

Vikram Rathour reunites with coach Rahul Dravid at Rajasthan Royals IPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals appointed Vikram Rathour as their batting coach for the upcoming season. The former India opener will reunite with Rahul Dravid, who was named as the head coach of the IPL franchise in September.

Champions League: Barcelona boss Hansi Flick sees positives despite Monaco lossBarcelona boss Hansi Flick said that he can see positives from his side's performance despite their loss to AS Monaco in the Champions League on Thursday, September 19. Barca lost 2-1 after Eric Garcia got a red card.

Chennai Test: Coach Morne Morkel all smiles after Akash Deep breathes fire India vs Bangladesh, 1st Test: Fast bowler Akash Deep picked two wickets in successive deliveries in his second over of the Test match in Chennai. Bowling coach Morne Morkel was thrilled to see the young pacer's success on Friday.

Travis Head eager to 'keep the chatter on' around his promotion as Test openerAustralian opener Travis Head is eager to keep the chatter on around his promotion as Test opener after match-winning innings against England in the first ODI.

Sanju Samson smashes 94-ball hundred in solid Duleep Trophy outing in AnantapurDuleep Trophy 2024: Wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson hit his 11th first-class hundred, smashing a 92-ball century for India D against India B in Anantapur. Samson made the most of the opportunity in the domestic red-ball tournament.

Watch: Virat Kohli, Chepauk applaud R Ashwin after 113 in Chennai TestVirat Kohli led the way with the applause for R Ashwin after his fantastic 113 against Bangladesh in the Chennai Test. The whole of Chepauk also gave Ashwin a standing ovation on Day 2 after he got out.

Bowling coach Morne Morkel was thrilled to see the young pacer's success on Friday.

Dinesh Karthik feels Ashwin, Jadeja 'will be valued a lot' after retirementFormer India cricketer Dinesh Karthik opined that India all-rounders Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja will be valued a lot after their retirement.

Hasan Mahmud 1st Bangladesh bowler to take Test five-wicket haul in India India vs Bangladesh, Chennai Test: Pacer Hasan Mahmud became the first Bangladesh bowler to take a five-wicket haul in a Test match on Indian soil and rattled India's batting lineup in the first innings of the first Test in Chennai.

Watch: David Raya makes incredible double save as Arsenal get point vs AtalantaDavid Raya pulled off an incredible double-save to help Arsenal salvage a point against Atalanta in the UEFA Champions League on Thursday, September 19. Raya's praise received a lot of praise for his effort.

IND vs BAN: 'Crisis-man' R Ashwin is underrated as a batter, says Tamim IqbalFormer Bangladesh opener Tamim Iqbal heaped praise on R Ashwin and claimed that the Indian star is underrated as a batter. Ashwin scored his 6th Test hundred on Day one of the Chennai  Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
